Baby Grand"What do you think?" Yuskov popped his knuckles. Silence. "Fine. I'll choose." And he began rummaging through a messy pile of papers. His friend shifted impatiently. "Ah, here it is: Rhapsody in Blue. Just like always." The piano glared up at him. "Don't give me that. Come now." He placed the music on its stand and his fingers on the ivory keys. The piano reluctantly gave in. "You rushed." He told the piano after he finished, "Playing half notes like quarter notes, and quarter notes like eigths." The piano's strings vibrated slightly. "That's what I thought." With a smug smile, he exited the dusty room. When Yuskov entered the next morning, the piano's bench was coughing. "Dear, dear, what is it? Need some help?" He knelt in front of the bench, waving dust out of his way and gripping its lid. He opened it a bit, enough to see the pictures of the woman, along with the sheet music to Unchained Melody inside.
